titleInfo.title: Plaque in Honor of Dr. Charles D. Spivak of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 5 x 4 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on envelope: ''#485 Dr. C.W. Spivak''. On back of photograph: ''Dr. Charles Spivak.'' Printers mark stamped on back.

mods.abstract: Plaque in honor of Dr. Charles D. Spivak, founder of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS). The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. It was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside Denver.
mods.note: Accession # 1271, Donated by AMC Cancer Research Center as part of the JCRS Records.
